Articles.Content:
Hello,

i recently found out about blender and decided to make some of my own parts for ksp.

right now i only made the cockpit(not completely), and would like to show it here.

i would appreciate any help and tips for blender, but please no harsh comments, as i am very new to blender.

Also excuse my language, as i do not live in america anymore.

thank you

Leoner Dwei.

There is an Add-on Development section of the forums for this kind of thread.

The Add-on Releases and Project Showcase section is for when you have a working mod that you want to release to everyone.

Don't worry about it to much though, you're not the first to make this kind of mistake, and a moderator will probably move your thread to the right section soon.
Truth, it really is in the wrong section but not a problem. Sometimes formality on posts like that creeps me out. I've been there when I was new in the forums. Yikes.
Indeed better if moved where this thread belongs, believe the discussion can be spotted by a few more interested users there. Please continue .

OK then, the first tip is: Take things step by step. First step is to learn blender. Forget everything else for now. Just have fun creating things.

Edited August 20, 2014 by Cpt. Kipard

OK then, the first tip is: Take things step by step. First step is to learn blender. Forget everything else for now. Just have fun creating things.

Coming from a guy who only learned what he needed when it was needed to get a part into the game as soon as I could, I can't say enough how true this advice is. Being comfortable with Blender will make everything else easier. I got started with a tutorial series by a YouTube user named CannedMushrooms. He has a lot of videos, but his Blender box modeling stuff is pretty good and directly applicable to modeling for games.
